fields.description:
It should be possible to export data to Microsoft Project. I'm not sure what fileformats Microsoft Project can import but I guess it can read some types of textformats.

When having registered estimates and time due for issues in jira it could be usefull to export the issues to Microsoft Project to generate graphs and gantdiagrams and so on.
fields.summary: It should be possible to export data to Microsoft Project

fields.description: When logging work done on an issue is look to me that it is not possible to edit the work I haved logged. This should be possible and would be usefull f.x. if I by a mistake log 2d instad of 2h on an issue.
fields.summary: Time tracking: It should be possible to edit work logged

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6126].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Right now it appears that the Assign Permission is all or nothing.

We would like force the "Assign To" functionality to limit the list of users to only be in the user group defined.
Thus, if the workflow step defined assigning to a developer, the user list will only display the list of developers.  If the workflow step is to assign to a QA Engineer, the QA Engineer would only have assign-permission to assign to another QA Engineer.

If would be even better if we can configure based on the user's group to specify which group of users should show. For example:-
User group A able to assign ticket to only user in group A
User group B able to assign ticket to users from group A and B
fields.summary: Limit "Assign To" list to specific user group

fields.description:
I would like the ability to set sharing of filters to a project (or project category).
Now I have to do a lot of administering (creating additional projectgroups) to do this.
Because we have a lot of projects this is a lot of work. Also helpfull to limit the number of shared filters on your dashboard (or the ability to choose which filter you see, instead of ALL filters would do the same I quess).

Ray
fields.summary: Share filter per project (or project categorie)
Provide short versions of field names for use in column titles

fields.description: After the issue status has been set to null and the corresponding current step record is removed, all integrity tests still pass.
fields.summary: Data Integrity Checker does not catch invalid issue statuses or currentsteps

fields.description:
We recently had a nasty problem with JIRA (it died, and refused to restart; it appears that the HSQL datastore may have become corrupted). So, I restored a previous backup, started up JIRA, exported it's data to an XML file, and shut it down.

I then installed Enteprise 3.1 and set up a MySQL database for it. Once it started up, I verified that it had connected to the MySQL database, build the schema, etc. All looks good. The JIRA page shows me a new installation, so I clicked the link to import existing data.

Trying to import the XML gives me this error:
Form Errors:
Failed to import data: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport@bd36fa, result: error Exception occurred: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [GenericEntity.set] "script" is not a field of Issue

I have attached the exported XML data file created by our original JIRA installation.

Our JIRA system is down, which pretty much means our organization is in chaos. We would very much appreciate prompt attention to this matter. Thank you.
fields.summary: Cannot reload exported XML data

fields.summary: JIRA fails to start; QA in desperate need of assistance!

fields.description:
I'd like some kind of wizard which allows me to quickly add CVS modules.  Ideally, I'd just provide a cvsroot, viewcvs root, username & password.  Then maybe a second page which lets me select which modules to add.  And then, blamo, I have all my cvs module defined. 

Or maybe instead of a wizard, you let me add multiple CVS repositories instead of modules, and just have a multi-select list of "active" modules in each repository.
fields.summary: Adding Many CVS Modules at Once

fields.description: Just to let you know.. each time I attach a screenshot to an issue, it logs me out of your system.
fields.summary: logout after attaching screenshot

fields.description: Depending on the browser, the issue navigator displays in different widths. Using the exact same login and filter, the column widths vary a great deal because the browser width itself changes from browser to browser. It seems like on Win2000 I.E. I rarely, if ever, get a horizontal scrollbar. On Win XP I.E. and MAC Safari I get a slightly wider window, and on Win XP Firefox, I get a really wide window. I am at home onWin XP so I am attaching those 2 screenshots to illustrate.
fields.summary: what controls issue navigator window width?

fields.description:
I try to add a CVS module to JIRA. See my attached screenshot for details on my setup.
Pressing the "Add" button lets my browser wait for ever, no activity in the JIRA console is visible.

I tried to create a local log file from a checked out module. That worked. Using a wrong password gives me an AuthenticationFailedException, so the access to the CVS seems to work, too.
fields.summary: Add CVS module does not work

fields.description:
There is a missing negation in the german translation of "You cannot vote or change your vote on resolved issues" (in closed issues):

"Sie können für gelöste Vorgänge stimmen oder Ihre Stimme zurückziehen."
           ^
I suggest the following:

"Sie können nicht für gelöste Vorgänge stimmen oder Ihre Stimme zurückziehen."
or
"Sie können für gelöste Vorgänge Ihre Stimme weder abgegeben noch zurückziehen."
fields.summary: German translation: Missing negation in voting description
Comment visibility (security) should be available in the mail

fields.description:
The email is not sent. All  emails stay in the queue.
Flushing the queue does sent all email. As far as I can see there is not exeception information.
fields.summary: Email not sent. Flushing does work.

set CATALINA_HOME=c:\isc\isc data\atlassian

fields.description:
To make longer descriptions easier to read it would be nice if we could have a rich text editor that could be used when entering text in description fields.

Another soulution could be to enable the notations from Confluene in description fields.
fields.summary: Rich Text editor or Confluence notation in description fields

fields.description:
Hmm... suddently my reports on the project page is gone.

I can't remember, that i've done any modifications in my setup that should cause the reports to dissapear. Could you point me in the right direction?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Where did my reports go?

fields.description:
The symptom of this problem is that the browser 'hangs' when accessing an issue URL like http://jira.<company>.com/browse/<issue>/. JIRA successfully serves other pages (eg. the dashboard), and the issue page if the URL is changed to http://jira.<company>.com/browse/<issue>?page=comments. Restarting JIRA does not help, but the problem may resolve itself if left for a long time. 

One cause of this is when a) the user is (unknowingly) requesting the 'All' tab (eg. from an email link), and b) the server's network connection to the CVS server is slow or broken.  In this situation, JIRA triggers a CVS update and parse, in order to serve the CVS tab contents to the first user.  The parse then hangs trying to read the CVS log:

"ApplicationServerThread" prio=1 tid=0x084cb180 nid=0x2c82 waiting on condition [8537b000..8537d87c]
        at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.util.LoggedDataInputStream.readLine(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.response.MessageResponse.process(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.Client.handleResponse(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.Client.processRequests(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.command.log.RlogCommand.postExpansionExecute(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.command.log.RlogCommand.execute(Unknown Source)
        at org.netbeans.lib.cvsclient.Client.executeCommand(Unknown Source)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.updateCvs(CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.java:308)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.updateCvs(CvsRepository.java:204)
        - locked <0x8ad4cd10> (a com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.updateRepository(CvsRepository.java:296)
        - locked <0x8ad4cd10> (a com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository)
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.getCommitsForIssue(CvsRepository.java:236)
        - locked <0x8ad4cd10> (a com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultActionManager.getCommits(DefaultActionManager.java:122)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultActionManager.getAllActions(DefaultActionManager.java:358)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultActionManager.getActions(DefaultActionManager.java:311)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.ViewIssue.getActions(ViewIssue.java:410)


Subsequent requests to view pages also hang, except they are waiting for the first thread to leave its synchronized() block around the CVS update:

"ApplicationServerThread" prio=1 tid=0x0857fed8 nid=0x2c82 waiting for monitor entry [84cfb000..84cfd87c]
        at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository.getCommitsForIssue(CvsRepository.java:234)
        - waiting to lock <0x8ad4cd10> (a com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepository)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultActionManager.getCommits(DefaultActionManager.java:122)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultActionManager.getAllActions(DefaultActionManager.java:358)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultActionManager.getActions(DefaultActionManager.java:311)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.ViewIssue.getActions(ViewIssue.java:410)
fields.summary: Slow / failing CVS access causes hangs when viewing issues

fields.description: As with Weblogic, we should add an option to precompile JIRA's JSPs for Resin.
fields.summary: Add Resin precompile option for WAR/Webapp edition
Add the ability to create release notes per project category
Don't apply security and login filters to images

fields.description: The components of some issues are not editable.  When we go to edit the issues, the component value is displayed with text "unknown".  No list control is presented.  Could this be a permission problem?  Surprisingly, our JIRA administrator was unable to edit the component as well.  The work around was to create a new issue with the desired component and mark the original as a duplicate.

fields.description:
I am wondering what our performance bottleneck might be. I am guessing the machine that the web server is on but i'm not sure. The machine has 4x Pentium Pro processors and 1GB RAM. Nothing else runs on this machine (we dug out the box from our warehouse, since nothing better was at hand). We have just over 3000 issues in our Jira and issue caching states they are all in cache. That summons up to 359MB used of 402MB allocated by the JVM. 

Here are the caching stats:
Current Cache Size   3265 
Cache Capacity       6000
Hits Count         185721
Miss Count          32256   

Jira is really slow when working with issues but reasonably fast when not working with issues (browsing administration section).

We use SQL Server 2000 as our database for Jira repository. During browsing the issues we don't see any activity on the database (or it might be too fast for us to record).

So finally my question: Where is the bottleneck? Is it the CPU and would it be better if we ran it on a workstation with P4 2.4GHz & 1GB RAM?
fields.summary: Performance question

Email created task with email attachments.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6093].
  {panel}

It would be nice to have a feedback if the creation of an issue by email fails for any reason.

Our customers doesn't have any feedback in case the issue is not created from their mail. Eg. they accidentally sent from a different email address than they regisitered in JIRA. 

The best would if it could be set that:
 - send a customizable email back to the sender and/or
 - send a detailed mail to specified email address (eg. to Lead Developer or would be better to handle it as an Email Issue Creation Fail event which would be customizable by project wich group/person would receive a notification)
fields.summary: Error response if issue creation by mail fails

fields.description:
When the following conditions are met:

* Idle-session expiration is enabled (I get automatically logged out after a some period of time)
* Such an amount of time has elapsed
* I have a jira page open in my browser

And I do the following:
* Search with "Quick Search"
   (I get no results -- consider changing this to display the login message)
* Click login on top blue bar
* Authenticate
* I get a server error 
  (Presumably b/c I'm back at the QuickSearch page with a GET)

Some details
URL: http://<HOST>/secure/QuickSearch.jspa
Referer URL: http://<HOST>/secure/Dashboard.jspa?os_destination=%2Fsecure%2FQuickSearch.jspa

Thanks,
Darren.
fields.summary: Session Expiration and Quick Search

fields.description:
The Browse Project page has links to hardcoded searches along the right:

Open Issues
  By Priority
    Major      10
    Minor      4
  By Assignee
    Joe Bloggs 4
    Fred       1
...

The links to searches in the 'Open Issues' section are all incorrect, as they do not specify a pid attribute (or in the case of priority, set it blank).  This is clearly incorrect, as the statistics alongside each link are project-specific.
fields.summary: Browse Project page: links to searches for Open Issues by Priority / Assignee do not specify project

fields.description:
1. New filter
2. Select component to search by
3. Press 'View >>'
When results shown the previously selected component is no longer selected.

This is very annoying as I want to minimize search result by adding some more criterias and re-search but I have to re-select the component every time.
fields.summary: The selected component is lost when search result shown

fields.description:
To reproduce:
1) Create a custom sub-task issue type (let's call the new type Type1), and give it its own workflow.
2) Create a sub-task (of type Type1) off some issue X
3) close the sub-task

The overall progress of sub-tasks for issue X is not updated. e.g. the sub-task progress bar shown in the issue-view will still show the issue as red.
fields.summary: Sub-task progress not updated for custom sub-task field type with custom workflow

fields.description:
For some tasks, it helps to have an overall view of a list of issues :
choose planned version, assignee or even priority. Jira provides this broad view with filters and reports, but update an item from such a view is not easy since you have to navigate between many screens.

May each filter provides an updatable view from which the displayed columns may be directly updated ?
fields.summary: Updatable reports aimed to prioritize a issues using a single screen

fields.description:
Receiving an e-mail for each event on a project can quickly become worrying
when we are not directly implied in this project
but we only need to be kept informed on its overall activity.

In such a situation, it would be nice to receive periodicaly an e-mail which is the result of a filter
like "all the issues which have been created today".

A proposal is to add a new kind of view to each filter. This view will be the place to subscribe a daily or weekly notification of the associated report.
fields.summary: filter based daily or weekly summary report notification
Include change history into the XML view of an issue

fields.description:
JIRA caches the attachment directory between imports - even after changing the project key for the second import.

Example: if first import project key is "AAA", a second import with "BBB" as project key will still attempt to place attachments in "AAA" related directory.
fields.summary: Bugzilla Import caches attachment directory between imports

fields.description:
Hi Guys,

   We've found an error in TwoDimensionalFilterStatistic Portlet. It duplicates columns and does not show columns for unsigned values (it shoulds). In the example I attach, you can see the same filter applied to two portlets "Filter Statistics" (which works fine), and "Two Dimensional Filter Statistics" (which doesn't). You can see that the resolution is duplicated and the asignee too, and does not appear colums and rows for unassigned issues and unassigned resolutions.

   If you look at the total, you can see that the result is incorrect.

   I've been looking for this bug in order to not duplicate it, but a couldn't find it.

   Regards,

   Andrés.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics ERROR

fields.description:
It would be nice to have field-level permissions (visible, hidden or read-only) for each group.
Examples are the 'Original Estimate' field that could be filled by dev team only, or some 'Path URL' custom url field that users could only read and follow.
fields.summary: Add field-level permissions

fields.description: CreateIssueHandler filters incoming messages according to catchemail directive, but deletes all messages, processed and not-processed ones. It seem be serious problem, when using this service for more than one project.
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler deletes all mails, not only processed ones.

fields.description:
The XML representation of issues do not currently include the CVS or Subversion notes displayed in the JIRA issue page.

If this information would be available, for example by introducing a new "<vcs-comment>" tag, then the Eclipse JIRA Plugin (and others) could display this information where it is actually _needed_, that is, in a window inside the IDE.

See also http://www.softwaretesting.de/jira/browse/ECLJIRA-68.
fields.summary: Add a <vcs-comment> tag

fields.description:
We have a requirement to make a simple view of Jira for clients, which is a page with:
1) a simple form for submitting new issues (hardcoded with some values)
2) a list of open issues
3) a list of resolved issues

2 & 3 is simple, but we can't find much documentation on the process of adding issues (which I assume is using XML-RPC). There is this: http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1035&showComments=true#comments
but it covers everything *but* manipulation.


thanks

Ben
fields.summary: finding an XMLRPC "how to" to create a simple form for submitting issues

fields.description: Just installed V3.1 and is seems that this functionality broke between V3 and V3.1.
fields.summary: Custom field defaults do not apply when creating sub-tasks

fields.description:
More intelligent handling of "mapped" field values in CSV Importer

Fields like status, issue types etc. almost always needs to be mapped. We can make this process more obvious by automatically trying to match the text. Or possibly even validate that the fields are indeed valid JIRA fields before letting the user continue.
fields.summary: More intelligent handling of "mapped" field values in CSV Importer

fields.description:
CSV Importer fails when issue type, status or summary is not set.

Three fields seem to be required at the moment:

* Issue types
* Staus
* Summary

There should be validation to ensure these are specified in the mappings file or intelligent defaults set / requested.

A constant issue type should be requested if missing. Status should default to opened one, summary should always be required.
fields.summary: CSV Importer fails when issue type, status or summary is not set.

fields.description:

- overdue issues
- issues with a particular resolution
- issues with a particular priority

fields.description: As in one of your competitor's products, I need the ability to restrict assignable users not just by Project but also by workflow status within the project. So, if an issue is being resolved, I would like the assignable user list to include only those members of the project (i.e. the QA department) that should test a resolved issue. Otherwise, developers tend to make mistakes and resolve issues to other people, or even to themselves.
fields.summary: restrict assignees by workflow

fields.description:
Hello, I'm the same person as JRA-6051.

At this moment everything we develop is in JIRA. We do this now for a year and every month the smiling-jira-user-group is growing.

Our projectmanagers are using MS Project or Open Workbench from Niku. This products are not bad but their is no integration between JIRA (the source for most developers) and this project-files.

And there we can't schedule issues, make gantt-charts or baseline in JIRA there is a gap in our organisation. This gap is the responsibility of the projectmanagers. They browse jira and bundle the issues in the projectmanagement software.

Is there a better solution?

Is the JIRA-msproject integration from mondo your advised solution?

Do you have plans for the near future in JIRA?
fields.summary: How do you suggest doing projectmanagement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-6051].
  {panel}

Hello, I'm Koen Renders from CIPAL in Belgium (one of your all-day users of Jira Enterprise).

We're now preparing to migrate to version 3.1. We're very happy with the workflow-option that is now available in JIRA. Great job.

We have a suggestion/question with this workflow: at this moment it's possible to select:

* or you go directly to the next step
* whether you want to select a new assignee
* or you want to select a resolution (when closing an issue).

Would it be possible to select the option "log work"? When selecting this option a user must enter his work (he can adjust the estimate etc.) for the step he comes from.

For us it may also be an option for the complete workflow (so you must enter it with every transition). Just an idea.

The result gets then:

* analysing         Koen Renders            4 hours
* programming       Alain Conings           3 days
* testing           Alien Wouters           4 hours
* documenting       Sindy Lenaerts          2 hours

Thanks.
fields.summary: Logging work during transition of an issue

fields.description:
- Log in to JIRA
- Run a query
- Open another tab in the browser
- Go to JIRA
- Do a different query
- The result in the first tab is affected by the query on the second tab


Sometimes, we'd like to run different queries on different tab.  It seems impossible for the release we are using.
fields.summary: Running different queries in different tab of Firefox browser

fields.description:
E-mail notification subjects are localized with actor locale, not recepient of the message. Thus I do receive messages in 4 lanugages: english, russian, french and german while my own locale is set to english.

Samples (subjects of the E-mail messages I receive from jira@jetbrains.net):
[JETBRAINS-JIRA] Erstellt: (IDEA-662) PeerFactory.getStructureVeiwFactory typo error
[JETBRAINS-JIRA] Assigned: (IDEA-662) PeerFactory.getStructureVeiwFactory typo error

[JETBRAINS-JIRA] Creee: (IDEA-621) Propagate parameters: make it work with "Introduce Parameter"
[JETBRAINS-JIRA] Assigned: (IDEA-621) Propagate parameters: make it work with "Introduce Parameter"

[JETBRAINS-JIRA] Создан: (IDEA-568) Support for Long CamelHumps
[JETBRAINS-JIRA] Kommentiert: (IDEA-528) Infinite loop and subsequent OOME on "Complete Line" action

while not actually very important still makes configuring rules in mail client a painful task. I do receive a lot of notifications and I'd like to separate comments user may add from workflow change notifications that usually not important for me.

fields.description:
Hello,

since nobody answered my mailing list entry I try it that way.

I found out, that the description of the add comment view can be changed at the following property files in the source code version.

\\jira\src\etc\languages\de_DE\com\atlassian\jira\web\action\issue\AddComment_de_DE.properties and \\jira\src\etc\languages\default\com\atlassian\jira\web\action\issue\AddComment.properties

How can I change it in the standalone version? Or how can I implement these changed files in the standalone version?

Best regards,

Markus
fields.summary: Changing the description of AddComment

fields.description:
Hello,

We are currently considering purchasing Confluence & Jira for our organization. I've been playing around with JIRA and quite happy with its functionality. However, our leadership requested a simple feature which I've noticed is lacking in JIRA. i.e Being able to add custom fields at the project level, just like the way JIRA adds at the issues level. This helps the management to track the project level status/risk/phases etc. I think this would be a killer improvement to Jira. As business people can then filter on custom fields at the project level while the techies can contiue using the issues level filters as it is available today. 

I could actually create custom fields throug Jelly and import data for those fields. In fact I can even import data into custom fields through CSV import into a project while creating multiple projects on the fly. I've tried this and it works. However, when I try doing a filter at the project level through dashboad. I am not able to retrieve any of that data I imported....I understand this being the fact that JIRA is focused at isssue level. I would sincerly appreciate if someone can get back to me and let me know if this is feasible for me to expect this improvement or not. Of course, this will decide wether we would replace Clearcase with Jira or not

Thank you 
Jeffi
602-378-225(desk)
602-206-0271(cell)
623-332-3427 (personal Cell)
fields.summary: Ability to add and filter custom fields at the project level

fields.description:
Create a filter which finds all issues you've reported, add a portlet which shows Fix For Version statistics of the issues. The generated URL doesn't include the project ID which is causing the link generated in the portlet to display all issues you've reported in the Issue Finder.

For example, the following generated link is supposed to show all issues I reported for version 1.1 of Confluence, however it displays all 92 issues I ever reported. Or actually make it 93 if you include this one. :)

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&reporterSelect=specificuser&reporter=sulka&fixfor=10542
fields.summary: Statistics: <filter> Fix for Version portlet links do not work

fields.description:
Currently Jira allows creating issues on Global, Issue type and single project scope. We have a number of non-related projects and using the global scope is hence quite tedious. However to make a field visible even in two projects, it has to be made global and then hidden in all field schemes except for the ones for those projects. This makes administrating the fields quite slow.

Ideally each field could be linked to n projects instead of just one. This would enable creating a non-global fields which still are visible in multiple projects.

I understand the current implementation from the software developer point of view (the current model is simple to implement) but from the end user point of view it's quite awkward.
fields.summary: Allow custom issue field project scope to link to multiple projects

So maybe when the filter is modified (or always) have the filter name as a link to reload/rerun/reset the filter.
(see screenshot)

fields.description:
When browse project, on right hand side, you will see many preset filters.  Clicking on the Priority filters (example, click on P2), you will see it lists all P2s including oterh projects.  

This used to work before we upgrade to JIRA 3.1.

Looks like the pid in the query is not picking up.

field.<<>> = project.lead

fields.description:
CVSNT allows you to set a repository prefix (see http://www.idevelopment.info/data/Programming/change_management/cvsnt/PROGRAMMING_Creating_a_CVS_Repository_CVSNT.shtml).  CVS repositories are then relative to the prefix.  This avoids having to use C:\... style paths in your CVSROOT.  In our case, our prefix is C:\cvsrepo.  We then access the repository mentioned below with CVSROOT=:...:/web.

Jira's CVS integration balks at this though - I get "Error parsing cvs log: RCS filename 'C:\cvsrepo\web\module1/.cvsignore,v' does not start with the provided root '/web/module1'" when trying to add the module.  

BTW: I can't use the full physical path (ie: CVSROOT=:...:C:\cvsrepo\web), as CVSNT won't allow this and returns "no such repository".
fields.summary: Error when using CVS repository prefix with CVSNT
